attributes.action: Raise the limit on attendees at weddings in England from 15 back to 30
attributes.additional_details:
The new limit is arbitrary and ridiculous because:
-Current rules still allow much larger numbers of people in pubs or restaurants
-Places of worship are still allowed to set their own occupancy limits on ordinary services, but not for wedding services
-Funerals are still allowed 30 attendees
-No evidence suggests that wedding services or receptions contribute more to transmission of Covid-19 than other gatherings

We therefore call for the reversal of this inconsistent, non-evidenced decision.
attributes.background: On the 22/9/2020 the Government reduced the number of people allowed at wedding services and receptions from 30 to 15 for up to 6 months. This arbitrary change causes yet more disruption to wedding plans, placing unnecessary additional mental stress on couples who have planned ceremonies this year.
